body_text:
Bugzilla: Bug 1370801 Bug 1377192
Opt-out studies are governed by a global opt-out preference that should be visible to users in the Advanced -> Data Choices section of about:preferences:

In lieu of any better guidance on preference naming (@gijsk?), let's call this pref app.shield.optoutstudies.enabled. It should:

Default to true
Be displayed as a checkbox below the "Share additional data" checkbox.
Be set to false if the FHR checkbox is set to false, in the same way the telemetry checkbox is.

Open question: Is this visual only, and the prefs keep the same values? And our code just needs to check both prefs? Or do we need to watch the pref value?



In particular, I think we should land this directly in Firefox, instead of adding this checkbox somehow via the system add-on. The preference can be used by the add-on, but doesn't need to disappear if the SHIELD add-on isn't present.
@MattGrimes Do we have copy for this new checkbox? Also, do we need a "Learn More" link, and where should that link to?
